identificationModule.briefTitle: Comparison of the Functional Walking Outcomes of Two Settings of a Commercially Available AFO in Adult Stroke Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Comparison of the Functional Walking Outcomes of Two Settings of a Commercially Available Ankle Foot Orthosis in Adult Stroke Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate how two different settings of a commercially available ankle foot brace affect how stroke patients walk. The study brace is an ankle foot orthosis (AFO) that makes use of a newer type of joint that contains a soft insert, in addition to the conventional hard stops, to limit the range of motion of the ankle during walking. The results of this study will help to clarify 1) whether and how this new joint affects the way you walk, 2) whether it makes it easier for the clinician to align your brace and 3) your opinions about the new joint.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The purpose of this study is to evaluate how two different settings of a commercially available ankle foot brace affect how stroke patients walk. The study brace is an ankle foot orthosis (AFO) that makes use of a newer type of joint that contains a soft insert, in addition to the conventional hard stops, to limit the range of motion of the ankle during walking. Participants undergo testing in the gaitlab after using the new brace for a period of time. The results of this study will help to clarify 1) whether and how this new joint affects the way you walk, 2) whether it makes it easier for the clinician to align your brace and 3) your opinions about the new joint.

conditions: Walking Aided by a Leg Brace in Stroke Subjects

armGroups.label: Conventional then Experimental brace resistance
armGroups.description: Participants received the Default intervention for a period of a month, were evaluated in the lab and then the novel intervention was administered for use for the next month. There was a small period (few hours in the lab) where the subject was transitioned to the second intervention.
interventionNames: Device: Conventional brace resistance (using hard stops)

armGroups.label: Experimental then Conventional brace resistance
armGroups.description: Participants received the the novel elastomer to provide brace support intervention for a period of a month, were evaluated in the lab and then the conventional intervention was administered for use for the next month. There was a small period (few hours in the lab) where the subject was transitioned to the second intervention.
interventionNames: Device: Conventional brace resistance (using hard stops)

interventions.name: Conventional brace resistance (using hard stops)
interventions.description: Conventional polypropylene custom molded ankle foot orthosis (MAFO) with Lawrence style double channel adjustable joints containing pins/springs

primaryOutcomes.description: walking velocity will be assessed by an electronic temporospatial foot-fall measurement system (gaitmat)

step length symmetry will be assessed by an electronic temporospatial foot-fall measurement system (gaitmat). symmetry will result in a ratio of step length on more involved or affected side compared to the less involved or affected (i.e. the "normal") side. as such, the measure will appear to have no units but actually will be a ratio of the same units (in this case, meters to meters).

step time symmetry will be assessed by an electronic temporospatial foot-fall measurement system (gaitmat). symmetry will result in a ratio of step time on more involved or affected side compared to the less involved or affected (i.e. the "normal") side. as such, the measure will appear to have no units but actually will be a ratio of the same units (in this case, seconds to seconds).

secondaryOutcomes.description: joint kinematics will be assessed using motion capture system
joint kinematics will be assessed using motion capture and biomechanical force measurement systems
activity will be measured using accelerometer based step activity monitoring devices
subject opinions will be measured using surveys and questionnaires

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Between the ages of 21 and 70 males and non-pregnant females
2. Diagnosis of stroke more than 1 year ago
3. Ambulatory at 0.5m/s or greater
4. Require unilateral AFOs to ambulate
5. Stable medical condition - no concomitant progressive diseases that could affect motor function
6. Ability to comply with directions and cooperate with research team

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Subjects who are currently receiving physical therapy for gait problems
2. Anticipated surgical or pharmacologic intervention for tone/contractures during the study period
3. Additional neurologic or musculoskeletal diagnoses that might impair gait (i.e., recent orthopedic interventions (6 weeks), unhealed fractures, significant degenerative joint disease, lower limb amputation, uncontrolled seizures)
4. Recent cardiac or active pulmonary disease, liable blood pressure
5. Recent back surgery

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: This is a cross over study - so all participants received both interventions (i.e. were in both study arms).

groups.title: Conventional Then Experimental Brace Resistance
groups.description:
Default intervention Conventional polypropylene custom molded ankle foot orthosis (MAFO) with Lawrence style double channel adjustable joints containing pins/springs

Experimental intervention Same MAFO but with ADR (soft polymer) providing brace resistance

groups.title: Experimental Then Conventional Brace Resistance
groups.description:
Experimental Condition Using the novel elastomer (ADR™ ) to provide brace resistance

Conventional Condition Same MAFO as above but using pins/springs to provide brace resistance

groups.title: Conventional Then Experimental Brace Resistance
groups.description:
Conventional intervention Conventional brace resistance (using hard stops): Conventional polypropylene custom molded ankle foot orthosis (MAFO) with Lawrence style double channel adjustable joints containing pins/springs

Experimental intervention Same MAFO as above but now using ADR™ soft polymer as brace resistance

groups.title: Experimental Then Conventional Brace Resistance
groups.description:
Experimental intervention Conventional polypropylene custom molded ankle foot orthosis (MAFO) with Lawrence style double channel adjustable joints containing ADR™ soft polymer as brace resistance

Conventional intervention Same MAFO as above but now using springs/pins as brace resistance

outcomeMeasures.title: Self-selected Walking Velocity
outcomeMeasures.description: walking velocity will be assessed by an electronic temporospatial foot-fall measurement system (gaitmat)

outcomeMeasures.title: Step Length Symmetry
outcomeMeasures.description: step length symmetry will be assessed by an electronic temporospatial foot-fall measurement system (gaitmat). symmetry will result in a ratio of step length on more involved or affected side compared to the less involved or affected (i.e. the "normal") side. as such, the measure will appear to have no units but actually will be a ratio of the same units (in this case, meters to meters).
